resources:
T-UI Version: Turn on GPS or network location Share Francesco Andreuzzi (Italy)
	-> Programmer 

Luke Winward (USA)
	-> Idea and design 

Alexander King (Australia)
	-> t-ui theme website and db management Refresh: apps, alias, music, contacts Thank you! T-UI started T-UI is running t-ui is having some issues. Please send to the developer your file crash.txt in the "t-ui" folder Lock the screen on double tap
Theme not found Invalid theme You don't have an old theme Reverted to the previous theme
An unknown error has occurred This is a directory File not found
T-UI notification reader Unfortunately t-ui can't redirect you to the "Notification access" page of your system settings
First time with t-ui? Use the command "tutorial" or "help" You have to grant Storage permission You can use "apps -default_app" instead

Do you like my work?
If yes, rate t-ui on Play Store (cmd: $ rate) or offer me a coffee (cmd: $ donate). Thank you! Did you know? t-ui is on Twitter. You can have a look with the cmd "$ tui -twitter" Did you know? There's a Telegram group with many enthusiastic users, where you can discuss, share and chat with the developer.
Just use the cmd "$ tui -telegram" Did you know? Our official Google+ community is full of tips, experimental apks and discussions.
You can have a look with the cmd "$ tui -googlep" Did you read the tutorial? If you don't remember how to view it, the cmd is "$ tutorial" Did you know that you can easily switch your theme? Have a look at the cmd "$ theme" Did you know? You can create your custom theme and share it to other users. Have a look at the cmd "$ theme -create" Are you having any doubts about a command? Just use the cmd "$ help cmdName" Did you know? You can listen your music without launching other apps but t-ui. Have a look at the cmd "$ music" Did you know? t-ui 6.4 introduced App Groups, a feature that let's you customize your app suggestions, creating different categories.
You can get more details with the cmd "$ apps -tutorial" Did you know? You can see your notifications directly from t-ui.
If you're interested, have a look at the tutorial: "$ notifications -tutorial" Are you sick of clearing your screen? Have a look at the options "clear_after_cmds", "clear_after_seconds" and "maxlines" Do you want to use your wallpaper as t-ui background? Use the cmd: "$ config -set system_wallpaper true" Are you having doubts about any config option? Use the cmd "$ config -tutorial" and look for that option inside the table Did you know that t-ui supports aliases? It also supports parameterized aliases.
For more info, use the cmd "$ alias -tutorial" Do you want to make t-ui lighter? Use the cmd "$ config -set enable_music false" to disable the music player and save resources
You can disable this messages with the cmd "$ config -set show_hints false"
Application not found Activity not found App installed: App uninstalled:
Calling: t-ui will be closed in some seconds. Click the home button to restart it
You didn't grant the permission Waiting permission There was a problem while connecting to your device camera Wrong number format Invalid argument Less arguments than expected Invalid integer Nothing was found There was an XML problem with your file , t-ui will use default values.
Fix or delete the file to recover your options Error: Invalid color Group not found This group already exists Spaces are not allowed inside group names
Alias not found: There was a problem with your alias The name of your alias: is equal to its value. This may lead to bad behaviors, so it has been excluded. You should edit the name to use it is equal to the part of its value before the first space (i.e. aliasName=play ; aliasValue = play store). This may lead to crashes and freezes, so it has been excluded. You should edit the name to use it
Print the list of commands, or info about a command 
Usage: 
help [command] 

Example: 
help exit
Exit from tuixt Save changes You pressed back key Saved Reading TUIXT This file is too big, consider opening it with an other text editor
WiFi active: Mobile Data active: Bluetooth active: Airplane mode active:
Playing: Player stopped Song not found enable_music is false!
Command not found.
Try to use ">>help" or ">>tutorial" Invalid option:
Flashlight ON Flashlight OFF Your device doesn't support flashlight
Battery charge: Mobile data: WiFi:
write your SMS or nothing to cancel Contact not found SMS not sent SMS sent
Toggle airplane mode Manage your aliases 

Usage: 
-add [aliasName] [alias content] -> add a new alias 
-rm [aliasName] -> remove an existing alias 
-ls -> list your aliases 
-file -> open alias.xml
Manage your apps 

Usage: 
-ls -> list your apps 
-lsh -> list your hidden apps 
-show [appName] -> re-show an hidden app 
-hide [appName] -> hide an app 
-l [appName] -> show details about an app 
-ps [appName] -> show Google Play Store page for an app 
-st [appName] -> show Settings details for an app 
-default_app [index] [appName or most_used or null] -> set the default_app at the specified index 
-frc [appName] -> force t-ui to launch an app 
-file -> open apps.xml 
-refresh [appName] -> refresh the "launched_times" value of the given app to 0 
-mkgp [groupName] -> create a new group with the given name 
-rmgp [groupName] -> delete the group with the given name 
-gpcolor [groupName] [color] -> set the color for the given group 
-addtogp [groupName] [appName] -> add the given app to the given group 
-rmfromgp [groupName] [appName] -> remove the given app from the given group 
-lsgp [OPTIONAL: groupName] -> list your groups, or list the content of the given group
Toggle bluetooth Clear the screen Perform basic operations (+ - * / % ^ sqrt) 
Example: 

>>calc 4+2-5 
1 

>>calc 2 ^ (2*2) 
16 

>>calc sqrt25 
5
Make a call 
Usage: call [number] OR [contactName]
Usage: 
-set [option] [value] -> set the value of an option 
-file [file] -> open a config file 
-get [option] -> get the value of an option 
-reset [option] -> reset the value of an option 
-apply [file] -> move a file to the t-ui directory
Toggle mobile data Usage: 
notify [title] [text] Offer a coffee to the developer (PayPal only) Toggle the flashlight Print a list of the available commands, or info about a command 
Usage: 
>>help [command]
Usage: 
-next -> play the next song in the queue 
-previous -> play the previous song in the queue 
-play -> play/pause 
-stop -> stop the player 
-ls -> list your tracks 
-select [song] -> play the selected song 
-info -> get info about the current song 
-seekto [seconds] -> seek to the selected part of the current song Leave a feedback on the Play Store page Refresh apps, alias, music, contacts Restart t-ui and load modified values Search something somewhere 

Usage: 
-gg [search this...] -> Google Search 
-ps [search this...] -> Google Play Store 
-file [search this...] -> Files 
-yt [search this...] -> YouTube 
-dd [search this...] -> DuckDuck Go
Share a file 
Usage: 
>>share [pathToFile]
Print the commands in /system/bin and /system/xbin Get info about battery charge, wifi status and mobile data Usage: 
-apply [theme] -> apply the selected theme (case sensitive). require internet connection. may take some seconds 
-view -> view the available themes 
-create -> create a new theme 
-old -> re-apply the theme that was replaced by the current one Print the current time with the given format 

Usage: 
$ time [index] (index means the index of the desired time_format Open the text editor. 
Usage: 
>>tuixt [textFile]
Usage: 
-rm -> remove t-ui 
-about -> show info about the developer and the current version 
-reset -> removes the t-ui folder and resets default settings (restart required) 
-twitter -> show t-ui Twitter page 
-googlep -> show the community on Google+ 
-telegram -> open the official Telegram group 
-folder -> print the path of the t-ui folder Open the tutorial page on GitHub Uninstall an application 
Usage: 
>>uninstall [appName]
Toggle wifi Send an SMS. 
Usage: 
>>sms [contactName] OR [number] 
>>[text]
Vibrate your device. 
Usage: 
>>vibrate [milliseconds] Emit a beep. 
Usage: 
>>beep Manage your notifications. 

Usage: 
-inc [appName] -> include an application 
-exc [appName] -> exclude an application 
-clr [color] [appName] -> set the color to be used for the application 
-file -> open notifications.xml 
-title_filter [ID] [regex] -> set a filter over notifications title with a given ID 
-text_filter [ID] [regex] -> set a filter over notifications text with a given ID 
-apply_filter [ID] [appName] -> apply a filter (or a group of filters) to a single application 
-access -> show the system settings page dedicated to the Notification Access Show the current location Manage your contacts. 

Usage: 
-ls -> list your contacts 
-l [contactName] -> show details about a contact 
-add -> create a new contact 
-edit [contactName] -> edit an existing contact 
-rm [contactName] -> remove a contact Close T-UI and reset launcher preferences
Interrupt the current shell process and create a new one Open a file 
Usage: 
>>open [pathToFile]
